pageTitle: Itinerary for Tuesday, July 18, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Tuesday, July 18, 2017:

Gaspé, Quebec

11:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will visit Forillon National Park.

Forillon National Park
Gaspé, Quebec

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should present themselves at the Visitor Interpretation Centre at the entrance to the North sector of the park (Sentier Prélude-à-Forillon) no later than 10:30 a.m.

Percé, Quebec

1:20 p.m. The Prime Minister will visit the town of Percé.

Percé, Quebec

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should gather outside the entrance to the Musée Le Chafaud  (145, Route 132 Ouest, rue du Quai) no later than 1:05 p.m.

Mont-Joli, Quebec

4:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will visit the Mont-Joli Municipal Day Camp to highlight the Canada Child Benefit. A media availability will follow.

Terrain de baseball Gérald-Deschênes
Parc du Centenaire
Mont-Joli, Quebec

Notes for media :

  • Photo opportunity of visit
  • Open coverage for media availability
  • Media should arrive no later than 3:30 p.m.

Rimouski, Quebec

5:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will visit the Pointe-au-Père Lighthouse National Historic Site.

Pointe-au-Père Lighthouse National Historic Site
1034, rue du Phare
Rimouski, Quebec

Notes for media :

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should arrive no later than 5:00 p.m.
